page.p1: Page type widgets represent a page from a website or web application accessed through a URL. When a web project receives a request by URL, BeyondJS takes care of identifying the widget with that defined URL to initialize the component and make it available in the DOM.
page.p2: Pages require the same configuration structure as any widget, but they also receive the following configuration parameters:
items1: route: <string>: Defines the URL or path to the component.
layout <string> [optional]: y defines whether you want to use a layout or not on your page.
vdir <string> [optional] : This allows you to define if you want to handle any dynamic value in the URL.
page.p3: URLs with dynamic values can be defined by adding variables to the route property with a syntax similar to template strings.
